title: Newtons second law - tension in string

content.prompt: When the system is released from rest, the tension in the string connecting blocks A and B is T1. The positions of blocks A and B are now switched, and the system is again released from rest. The tension in the string connecting blocks A and B after their positions are switched is T2. Is T1=T2 ? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the acceleration of the three-block system will be the same as in the original setup.
Yes, because the net external force acting on the three-block system is the same as in the original setup.
No, because the force of tension in the string accelerates a less massive block than in the original setup.
No, because the acceleration of the system will be larger than in the original setup when the more massive block is moved closer to the pulley.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
